messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Schuyler's birthday
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you, all of you, for the wonderfully thoughtful well-wishing for me making another trip around the sun. You made me smile, many times, so thank you.
messages.messageBody:
Thank you, all of you, for the wonderfully thoughtful well-wishing for me making another trip around the sun. You made me smile, many times, so thank you.

Schuyler
www.waynforth.blogspot.com

Happy Birthday, Schuyler!

It was a delight to meet you and your family at the Life is Good
conference.

Hope your ensuing 41st year brings you much joy :-)

Robin B.
Issaquah, WA

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Schuyler's birthday
messages.msgSnippet: On Sat, Jul 19, 2008 at 12:53 AM, Schuyler  ... I can see the smile on Linnaea s face when she told me of the flower with her name
messages.messageBody:
On Sat, Jul 19, 2008 at 12:53 AM, Schuyler <s.waynforth@...>
wrote:

> Gawrsh, as Goofy would say. What a wonderful thing to wake up to. That
> and coffee in the Linnaea Borealis mug my mom gave me.
>




I can see the smile on Linnaea's face when she told me of the flower with
her name :D There's a birthday gift!


> I had a really brilliant yesterday, I couldn't have asked to say good-by to
> the 30's in a better way.
>
>
>


4 completed decades... two years from physical embodiment of "the answer"
according to Douglas Adams :) it's kinda like standing on a summit and
having a pretty dang good view! Knowing that while there's still climbing
and exploring to be done, you've come a long way (it ain't Nebraska no
more!) and it's all been a Schuyler-worthy experience :)
--
~diana :)
xoxoxoxo
hannahbearski.blogspot.com


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Schuyler's birthday
messages.msgSnippet: Gawrsh, as Goofy would say. What a wonderful thing to wake up to. That and coffee in the Linnaea Borealis mug my mom gave me. I had a really brilliant
messages.messageBody:
Gawrsh, as Goofy would say. What a wonderful thing to wake up to. That and coffee in the Linnaea Borealis mug my mom gave me.

I had a really brilliant yesterday, I couldn't have asked to say good-by to the 30's in a better way.

Thank you.
Schuyler
www.waynforth.blogspot.com


----- Original Message ----
From: Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, 19 July, 2008 4:18:44 AM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Schuyler's birthday

DOH!

All day yesterday I kept thinking "Friday is someone's anniversary,"
and I knew it was someone's something....

Well I came back across Schuyler's blog and she turned 40 today.
It's not her birthday in England anymore, but it's still her birthday
in New Mexico! Happy Birthday.

We can't birthday everybody on the list, but I'll tell you what:
Schuyler has really made things easier for a lot of unschoolers in
ways they don't even realize, by being a huge help on this list and
UnschoolingDiscussion, as a moderator and advisor and peacemaker.

Thanks for that, Schuyler.

Sandra

------------------------------------

Yahoo! Groups Links



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Schuyler's birthday
messages.msgSnippet: Schuyler, I m pretty sure I ve never written to you before, so you probably don t know me at all, but I make a point of reading your cheerful, gentle,
messages.messageBody:
Schuyler, I'm pretty sure I've never written to you before, so you probably
don't know me at all, but I make a point of reading your cheerful, gentle,
sensible, forthright, hope-inducing, creative, accepting, delightful posts
here and on Peacefulpartnerships. I'm glad to hear you are so young, so
that we'll have many more years to enjoy you. Very happy birthday to you.
Clarissa in Seattle
mom to a 5yo dd


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the heads up! I was gone out of town all day  and have not had time to check blogs . I LOOOOOOOOVe Schuyler and her family so much we have named
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the heads up! I was gone out of town all day  and have not had time to check blogs .
I LOOOOOOOOVe Schuyler and her family so much we have named them our kids guardian if ever needed.
Happy Birthday Schuyler!!!!!!

 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/
 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/
